posts.author: Apocrypha
posts.content:
Hey all! I was trying to think up of another character for an RP server, and I had the bright idea of a cleric of Mask. My goal is to be a melee "scrapper" who can heal, stealth, scout, and handle locks/traps if need be. Essentially a "jack of all trades". It'll be great if I build it right, and fall flat on its face if I don't.

Cleric is going to be the primary class for the build, with Rogue a second for the loads of skillpoints and fitting Mask flavor-wise. I'm struggling somewhat between Shadowdancer and Assassin for the third classes-- Assassin brings neat Invisibility and death attacks to the table, but Shadowdancer has HiPS. Something to note is that my server restricts single-level dips--I have to take at least three levels of a class, so I can't just take one level of SD and call it a build. Alternately, if there's another possibility I'm overlooking for a third class, please tell me! Since Darkness and Luck didn't make it into the game, Trickery and Evil will be the domains chosen for proper roleplay purposes. I'm happy about Trickery, not so thrilled about Evil, but ce la vie.

I'll be going DEX-based and foregoing heavy armor, though I'm not sure whether I'll do dual-wielding or use a light shield, because I don't know if I prefer the extra attack over the extra AC yet. The weapon needs to be finessable, obviously, and I don't really have a preference as to what it is. No DM/DS, since I have to dump CHA for DEX/INT/WIS.

A (very) rough sketch:

Human or Half-Elf, NE
(Cleric/Rogue/???) (Level cap 40)
PvM

STR: 10
DEX: 16
CON: 12
INT: 14
WIS: 15
CHA: 8

Skills: Bluff, Concentration, Disable Devices, Hide, Move Silently, Open Locks, Search, Tumble
Feats: Weapon Finesse is the only one I require.

posts.author: Theophilus Fist
posts.content: If you want undispellability and Epic Dodge, you have to go Cleric 24/25. Rogue 10, SD 5. Oddly enough I do not see that level split in the database.

posts.author: Apocrypha
posts.content:
That looks almost exactly like what I want, Mick! I'd still like to play around with the skills and classes, but that's a really good base. Thanks!

So what I'm looking at, as build options, are Mick's suggested Cleric 24/Rogue 16, Cleric 24/Rogue 11/Assassin 5, or Cleric 24/Rogue 11/Shadowdancer 5.

Going off the class progression tables (ie, without laying everything out, ie going by an estimate), Cleric 24/Rogue 11/Assassin 5 gets me 3d6 death attack, Darkness, Ghostly Visage, Use Poison, and costs me 20 skillpoints, 2d6 sneak attack, two bonus feats, and 1 BAB. Cleric 24/Rogue 11/Shadowdancer 5 gets me HiPS, darkvision, and the shadow daze/summon shadow/shadow evade abilities, while costing me 10 skillpoints, 2d6 sneak attack, 1 BAB, and a bonus feat. Shadowdancer 5 gets Defensive Roll, which negates the loss of one of the bonus feats.

Thoughts?

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content: SD also needs two feats that my build doesn't have. It will probably cost you the two weapon fighting.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: There are those that say that if a build doesn't have three classes, it isn't optimal, but I say that is nonsense. This build would weakened by adding a third class.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
It's not nonsense, Empyre, it's 100% true. But the claim doesn't preclude any restrictions (such as taking a minimum of 3 levels of each class).  Cleric 23 Rogue 13 Fighter 4 is better than this build, but since it's RP, Mick's build is quite good.

Apocrypha, look for a topic called Black Flame Zealot in this section. I posted a Cleric 15 / Fighter 6 / Rogue 19, which is also a very good option for you to consider. Both spreads that you spoke about are bad. No reason for Rogue 11, no reason for Assassin 5. You can either take Mick's build, which is very good for RP, even if it has only 2 classes, or put 4 levels of Fighter for 3 extra feats and access to Epic Weapon Specialization to help with damage at the expense of 5% dispellability, one Rogue bonus feat, 1d6 SA damage and a few skill points (but free weapon proficiencies).

Take it EZ!

Fighter 4 is a neat suggestion, but I'm gonna pass because a) it doesn't quite fit RP, and b) it'll give me an XP penalty, but I'll make a note about the possibility when I post the build proper (which should be either tonight or tomorrow morning).

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content: I will side with Mick & Empyre here, not all builds are stronger with three classes, sometimes you must have less to gain more. Mick's (cleric 24/bard 16) build was a recent perfect example of a two-class combo that a third class would probably weaken.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
When I made the cleric/rogue build above, I tried with both fighter and SD as a third class, but decided against it.
With 1-3 SD I would lose two weapon fighting and crippling strike, but would gain HIPS and a pre epic feat to take improved critical (or something else).
With 4 fighter levels I would gain 3 feats, 2 of which would be reserved for WS & EWS. The price would be later cleric development, dispellable buffs, no crippling strike, and 20% xp penalty throughout many levels. It was also a factor that clerics are able to generate a lot of damage when they buff up.
Those different builds have their uses, and what is stronger depends to a great extent on the environment. But that has nothing to do with RP or not.

On a side note; The Divine tickery ability adds +13 to the relevant skills and enables epic trap handling.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Valerfor wrote:
I will side with Mick & Empyre here, not all builds are stronger with three classes, sometimes you must have less to gain more. Mick's (cleric 24/bard 16) build was a recent perfect example of a two-class combo that a third class would probably weaken.
Cleric 23 Bard 16 Monk 1 would be absolutely stronger. You can't argue with facts. All builds will benefit from a 3rd class, but some concepts can be more important than the additional power you gain. That's exactly the case here.

Mick, if you feel you can forego WS and EWS, you can take EWF, AS and EP with the Fighter feats, which would free 3 feats for Great Dexterities and higher AB and AC .

Anyway, build looks good, but I would start with 8 STR and 14 CON.

Take it EZ!
